channel.title: nodejs on Jarrod Linahan
channel.description: Recent content in nodejs on Jarrod Linahan

item.title: Using Pug templates with Sails.js
item.description: For a while now I’ve been hacking on a few Sails.js based projects, my long-running pet project ZHDict being one of them. After hacking on some Hexo themes, the first of which (which you’re currently looking at) uses Pug templating (the template engine formerly known as Jade) behind the scenes to render the HTML, and I’ve kinda grown to like it. You can think of pug as the love-child creation of Python and HTML after a steamy night of flipping bits.

item.title: Node.js vs Java Play! Framework
item.description: After having somewhat of a heated Facebook conversation with a friend about the Ups and Downs of various web frameworks, I was inspired to benchmark a simple “Hello World” to compare the speed and resource usage of Node.js and the Play! Framework (using Java). Being mostly Perl guys ourselves, my go-to tool for web wizardry is generally the awesome Catalyst MVC framework, can’t say the same about my friend. All the tests below were completed on my Laptop â€“ Intel Core i5 M480 CPU @ 2.
